metadata.title: CVE-2018-12327 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible
metadata.description: Stack-based buffer overflow in ntpq and ntpdc of NTP version 4.2.8p11allows an attacker to achieve code execution or escalate to higherprivileges via a long string as the argument for an IPv4 or IPv6command-line parameter. NOTE: It is unclear whether there are any commonsituations in which ntpq or ntpdc is used with a command line from anuntrusted source.

criterions.comment: ntp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
